results.title: The Old man who read love stories
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Michelle de Broca, Julie Ryan, Sociedo Kino Vision, Magnetic Hall and Fidebroc
results.brief_description: Expressive romantic tale, which invokes the spirit of South American author Garcia Marquez, about an aging man who strives to atone for past errors in order to embrace a new romance. Whilst living in a remote part of the Amazon jungle, Antonio becomes a virtual recluse following the death of his beloved. Within his jungle home he has only one friend, a charismatic lothario (Hugo Weaving) who introduces him to Josefina, a beautiful local woman who works for the mayor, a corrupt official. When the mayor grants illegal visas to poachers, a litter of jaguar cubs is slain; the fearsome mother finds and kills the poacher, but having acquired a taste for human blood, the village is now in peril. The mayor suggests a hunting party, lead by Antonio. During the hunt, Antonio recalls key incidents from his past, including his marriage, his passion for Josefina, his love of reading and his friendship with a native that contributed his sadness. Rolf de Heer (Bad Boy Bubby, The Tracker) evokes a handsome story of redemption, lyrically encapsulated within the old man’s memories, whilst presenting a paradisaical, if brutal, environ.
results.title_for_label: The Old man who read love stories

results.title: The Old man and the sea
results.creator_credit: Judd Taylor, Robert E. Fuisz, William F Storke and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description: A stunning dramatisation of Hemingway’s epic tale of struggle between man and nature. Anthony Quinn stars as Santiago, whose encounter with a giant Marlin becomes a fight for survival as a band of sharks move in for the kill. Filmed on location on the British Virgin Islands, this film combines action-packed excitement with outstanding human drama.

results.title: The Old man's story
results.creator_credit: Yvonne MacKay, Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Story of a boy on his uncle’s farm in New Zealand during the 1920s. During his stay, the farm’s handyman is driven to suicide when accused of molesting an orphan girl who comes to work on the farm. Adapted from a short story by Frank Sargeson.

results.creator_credit: Koorie Heritage Trust and Lee Stewart
results.brief_description: Lee Stewart pays tribute to his father who coached the local football team and was an inspiration to his sons and his players. This digital story was created in partnership with the Koorie Heritage Trust.

results.title: The Old lady's camping trip
results.creator_credit: Les Drew, David Verrall, Douglas MacDonald, Derek Lamb and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In a lively animated lesson about the do’s and don’ts of fire and outdoor safety, the Old Lady Who Lived in a Shoe takes all her children and Cousin Jim off on a summer camping trip. And to make sure that needless accidents won’t spoil their fun, she plays it smart by observing the rules. Cousin Jim, however, unaware of rules, has several close calls with disaster until the Old Lady steps in and teaches him the ABCs of safe, enjoyable outdoor living. When it comes to fire prevention, the Old Lady knows just what to do. Do you? (Award: Espinho) Also available on DVD [319319].

results.title: The Oil rivers
results.creator_credit: Sydney Latter, James Mellor, Editorial Film Productions and Unilever Films
results.brief_description: Long ago the white trader explored the rivers of the dark Nigerian rain forests. A group of them he named the “Oil Rivers” for in the surrounding bush the wild oil palm struggled towards the sunlight. To the African this tree has always provided a staple and vital food. The harvesting and extraction of the oil and kernels engaged the energies of the whole village. Today the harvest is the basis of one of Nigeria’s most imnportant exports, which must be developed by new methods in mill and plantation, without disrupting much that is valuable in the traditional ways of life.

results.title: The Oil palm
results.creator_credit: Douglas Hill, Dudley Birch, Unilever Films and Birch Hill Film Productions
results.brief_description: Palm-oil and palm kernel oil have been used since the Pharoahs imported the products from West Africa 3,000 years ago. At a plantation in the Cameroons, we follow production through picking, separating, fermenting, and pulping, to the extracting of the oil from the palm fruit. The oils are used in food manufacture, margarine, chemical industries, soap and in processing leather and textiles.

results.title: The Office: the complete second series [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stephen Merchant, Ricky Gervais, Ash Atalla and BBC
results.brief_description: The Office is a bitingly satirical British television series set in a paper merchant’s office and factory in Slough. David Brent, a delusional manager who believes himself to be witty, universally adored, efficient and effective, runs the branch. Series two sees the office of Slough merging with Swindon. In an attempt to win his new staff over, David utilises his trademark off-colour humour. But his attempt at ingratiation only serves to alienate staff. Brent also has a new boss, Neil, a genuinely appealing, popular and efficient manager who stands for none of Brent’s inadequacy. Ep 1: Swindon staff are welcomed to Slough, most of whom get off to a bumpy start with Brent. Ep 2: Brent’s envy of Neil’s style and charm see him act petulantly and treacherously. Ep 3: Tim forms an attraction to new girl, Rachel; their flirtatious interactions trouble Gareth and Dawn. Trudy celebrates her birthday with a boozy evening. Ep 4: Brent prepares for his highly paid motivational speech. Ep 5: comedy relief day brings out the best and worst in staff. Brent is given a formal warning about his work standards. Ep 6: Dawn is conflicted over her future and her romantic life. Adhering to a mockumentary structure, a camera crew follow the workers around, documenting office life - boredom, bad jokes, uncomfortable moments, embarrassing faux pas and the emptiness of at work interactions that pass the day. Features fine performances and much hilarious to-camera addresses, skillfully capturing the monotony of office work, where relieving ennui is a fulltime job.

results.title: The Office: the complete first series [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stephen Merchant, Ricky Gervais, Ash Atalla and BBC
results.brief_description: First series of the bitingly satirical British television series, “The Office”. Ricky Gervais plays David Brent, the manager of a paper merchant factory and office in Slough. Gervais is an identifiable type in the workplace - a delusional man who believes himself to be witty, universally adored by his staff, efficient, and an effective boss with impeccable people and business skills. Adhering to a mockumentary structure, a camera crew follow the workers around, documenting office life - boredom, bad jokes, uncomfortable moments, embarrassing faux pas and the emptiness of at work interactions that pass the day. Features fine performances and much hilarious to-camera addresses, whereby characters vent their deepest frustrations. “The Office” skilfully captures the monotony of office work and the relieving of ennui with innumerable trivialities. Ep 1 - Introduces the main characters including arch petty rivals Tim and Gareth; establishes the budding romance between Dawn and Tim. Ep 2: When a pornographic picture of Brent is circulated, Gareth investigates. Ep 3: Tim’s birthday; quiz night at the pub. Ep 4: Staff training day. Ep 5: Tim considers resignation; Gareth takes an unhealthy interest in the new girl. Ep 6: Cutbacks cause staff disgruntlement.
